concept.title: Ski track
concept.shortdesc: Short topic on how the cross-country ski track looks like.

conbody.p: The cross-country ski track is delivered in two forms. First of them is called "classic" and basically looks like two chemins d'Ã©carts in the snow. The other one consists just of plowed snow of at least 2 meters width which leads somewhere. It's called "skate track". The differences of these two types are caused by the existence of two different techniques of cross-country skiing. Each of the track type is dedicated to one of these techniques. For more detail, please find other topics.
